definitions: To interrupt or cut off; To repress, keep in or hold back; To smother or suffocate; To feel smothered etc.; To die of suffocation; To treat a silkworm cocoon with steam as part of the process of silk production; That has been interrupted, suppressed etc
examples: The army stifled the rebellion.; The heat was stifling the children.; The heat felt stifling.; Two firemen tragically stifled in yesterday's fire when trying to rescue an old lady from her bedroom.
